revised_title: Synthesis and Properties of Lactic Acid Derivatives
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the reaction between ethyl oxalate and amyl iodide with zinc, resulting in the synthesis of various lactic acid derivatives. They discovered new ethers, acids, and salts with unique properties, such as ethylic amylhydroxalate, ethylic diamyloxalate, and amyloxalic acid. These findings expanded the understanding of lactic acid derivatives and their potential applications.
